item.title: 12 Rules for life
item.description: Following Jordan Peterson 12 rules for life, I want to write my own. Keeping in mind that these can and will probably change over time which can sound contradictory because rules should not change, but I understand my limitations and understand that people change points of view. So here it goes: Assume your temperament will always be somewhat childish and impatient, and set your rules accordingly, knowing that you cannot abide by rules for rules sake.

item.title: Free Books
item.description: The Open Source community is amazing, they do great work and share it freely with the world. I have compiled a list of free books and will continue to update it as I find more. R for Data Science Efficient R programming [Creating Websites with R Markdown] (https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/) R Markdown: The Definitive Guide Text Mining with R Happy Git and GitHub for the useR Modern Data Science with R [The Unix Workbench] (https://seankross.

item.title: Quotes
item.description: I will be updating this page with my favorite quotes “When the facts change, I change my opinion. What do you do, sir?”” ‚Äï John Maynard Keynes ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not what you preach, it‚Äôs what you tolerate.‚Äù ‚Äï Jocko Willink ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt expect to be motivated every day to get out there and make things happen. You won‚Äôt be. Don‚Äôt count on motivation. Count on Discipline.‚Äù ‚Äï Jocko Willink ‚ÄúCare about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.
